title: Reiki - Special Subjects - Merck Manuals Professional Edition
author: MILLSTINE DENISE
description: Reiki - Etiology, pathophysiology, symptoms, signs, diagnosis & prognosis from the Merck Manuals - Medical Professional Version.
cleaned_text: Reiki, which originated in Japan, is a type of energy medicine. In Reiki, practitioners intend to channel energy through their hands and transfer it into the patient's body to promote healing. A systematic review of Reiki in the treatment of pain and anxiety suggested beneficial results ( [1, 2](/en-pr/professional/special-subjects/integrative,-complementary,-and-alternative-medicine/reiki#v39504801) [ References Reiki, which originated in Japan, is a type of energy medicine. In Reiki, practitioners intend to channel energy through their hands and transfer it into the patient's body to promote healing... read more ](/en-pr/professional/special-subjects/integrative,-complementary,-and-alternative-medicine/reiki#v39504801) ). However, high-quality clinical trials of Reiki are limited, and evidence is mixed. Other systematic reviews have not shown a benefit in depression ( [3](/en-pr/professional/special-subjects/integrative,-complementary,-and-alternative-medicine/reiki#v39504801) [ References Reiki, which originated in Japan, is a type of energy medicine.
